newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Most ABB segments boost earnings.
newsitem.headline: Most ABB segments boost earnings.

text.p: ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG said operating earnings at three of its five business segments had risen in the first nine months of the year from last year.
ABB said in its nine month report that operating earnings at the Power Generation segment "were well below" the level reported last year and "are expected to remain so for the full year."
ABB said this reflected continuing competitive market conditions and lower imputed interest income on custumer advances.
Orders at power generation, however, were above last year's level while sales were about the same.
Operating earnings at Power Transmission and Distribution continued to be "substantially above" last year with most business areas contributing to this result.
Operating earnings at Industrial and Building Systems, ABB's largest segment, had improved "substantially" on continued productivity gains, cost-reduction programmes and increased volume, ABB said.
Orders at Industrial and Building Systems was also higher.
At Adtranz, the rail venture with Daimler-Benz AG, operating earnings were "positive and in line with expectations," but still below that of ABB Transportation in the same period last year.
ABB added that the positive effects of restructuring and elimination of duplication will mainly come in 1997 and 1998.
Earnings at the Financial Services Segment continued to increase "substantially", reflecting higher treasury centre earnings and a better result in insurance.
